kollacli.api package¶

Submodules¶

kollacli.api.async module¶

class kollacli.api.async.AsyncApi[source]¶

Bases: object

async_deploy(hostnames=[], groupnames=[], servicenames=[], serial_flag=False, verbose_level=1)[source]¶

Deploy.

Deploy containers to hosts.

async_host_destroy(hostnames, destroy_type, verbose_level=1, include_data=False)[source]¶

Destroy Hosts.

Stops and removes all kolla related docker containers on the specified hosts.

async_host_precheck(hostnames, verbose_level=1)[source]¶

Check pre-deployment configuration of hosts.

Check if host is ready for a new deployment. This will fail if any of the hosts are not configured correctly or if they have already been deployed to.

async_upgrade(verbose_level=1)[source]¶

Upgrade.

Upgrade containers to new version specified by the property “openstack_release.”

kollacli.api.deploy module¶

class kollacli.api.deploy.DeployApi[source]¶

Bases: object

deploy_set_mode(remote_mode)[source]¶

Set deploy mode.

Set deploy mode to either local or remote. Local indicates that the openstack deployment will be to the local host. Remote means that the deployment is executed via ssh.

Parameters:remote_mode (bool) – if remote mode is True deployment is done via ssh

ssh check for hosts

return {hostname: {‘success’: True|False,
‘msg’: message}}
host_get_all()[source]¶

get all hosts in the inventory

host_get_groups(hostname=None)[source]¶

get groups for hosts

Return: - if hostname, {hostname: [groups]} - else, {hostname: [groups], hostname: [groups]...}

host_remove(hostnames)[source]¶

remove hosts from the inventory

host_setup(hostname, password)[source]¶
host_setup_hosts(hosts_info)[source]¶

setup multiple hosts

hosts_info is a dict of format: {‘hostname1’: {

‘password’: password ‘uname’: user_name }

} The uname entry is optional.

kollacli.api.job module¶

class kollacli.api.job.Job(ansible_job)[source]¶

Bases: object

get_console_output()[source]¶

get command output

get the console output from the job. Returns a string containing the console output of the job.

get_error_message()[source]¶

get error message

if job failed, this will return a string with the error message.

get_status()[source]¶

get status of job

Status: - None: still running - 0: complete/success - 1: complete/fail

wait()[source]¶

wait for job to complete

return status of job (see get_status() for status values)
